question: Gate AB in <image 1> is a quarter circle 10 ft wide into the paper and hinged at B . Find the force F just sufficient to keep the gate from opening. The gate is uniform and weighs 3000 lbf.
description:
The image depicts a quarter-circle gate labeled AB, which is submerged in water. The gate is hinged at point B and has a radius of 8 feet. The gate is 10 feet wide into the paper, indicating its depth. There is a force \( F \) applied vertically downward at point A, which is the top of the gate. The gate is uniform and weighs 3000 pounds-force (lbf). The question asks for the force \( F \) just sufficient to keep the gate from opening. The options provided are:

A. \( F = 7490 \) lbf
B. \( F = 7470 \) lbf
C. \( F = 7480 \) lbf
